name: Angola
description: Angola, officially the Republic of Angola, is a country in southwestern Africa. It’s known for its vast oil reserves, diverse landscapes ranging from deserts and savannahs to coastal areas and rainforests, and a rich, complex history shaped by Portuguese colonization and a long struggle for independence. The country boasts significant biodiversity and is experiencing rapid development, though challenges remain in terms of poverty and infrastructure.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital and largest city of Angola.
quickFacts.detail: Luanda is a major port city and economic hub, characterized by its vibrant culture and rapidly growing skyline.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Angola's population is diverse, with a mix of ethnic groups.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population lives in rural areas, primarily engaged in agriculture.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Angola is the second-largest country in Africa.
quickFacts.detail: It borders Namibia, Zambia, Democratic Republic of the Congo, and the Republic of the Congo.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Portuguese is the official language, a legacy of colonial rule.
quickFacts.detail: However, numerous indigenous languages are also spoken throughout the country.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The Kwanza has experienced significant fluctuations in value.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Angola's economy is heavily reliant on oil.
quickFacts.detail: Diversification efforts are underway to reduce dependence on the oil sector.

climateData.title: Angolan Climate
climateData.description: Angola experiences a tropical climate with significant regional variations. The coastal areas are hot and humid year-round, while inland regions have distinct wet and dry seasons. Rainfall is generally high, particularly along the Atlantic coast and in the northern highlands.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This is the coolest and driest period of the year, characterized by clear skies and low humidity.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings heavy rainfall, flooding, and increased humidity. Temperatures remain consistently high.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Harmattan Winds
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A dry, dusty wind originating from the Sahara Desert, bringing cooler temperatures and reduced visibility.

naturalWonders.name: Etosha National Park
naturalWonders.description: Etosha National Park is one of Africa’s premier wildlife destinations, renowned for its vast salt pan and abundant animal populations. It’s a haven for elephants, lions, rhinos, zebras, and countless bird species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park’s unique ecosystem offers exceptional opportunities for game viewing, particularly around the waterholes that attract animals from across the surrounding area. The salt pan, a vast expanse of white salt, creates a surreal and unforgettable landscape.
viewingTips: Wake up early for optimal wildlife sightings
Bring binoculars and a spotting scope

naturalWonders.name: Quilos Archipelago
naturalWonders.description: The Quilos Archipelago, located off the coast of Angola, is a unique and fragile ecosystem comprised of mangrove forests, coral reefs, and sandy islands. It’s a vital breeding ground for marine life and a crucial habitat for numerous bird species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The archipelago’s mangrove forests provide shelter and nursery grounds for fish and crustaceans, while the coral reefs support a diverse array of marine life. The islands are home to nesting seabirds and offer stunning coastal scenery.
viewingTips: Take a boat tour to explore the islands
Snorkel or dive in the coral reefs

ecosystemData.title: Angolan Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Angola’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from the arid Namib Desert in the west to the lush rainforests of the north and the coastal mangrove swamps. These ecosystems support a remarkable array of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Savanna
biodiversityCategories.description: Vast grasslands dotted with acacia trees, supporting large herds of herbivores and their predators.

statistics.details: Includes elephants, giraffes, zebras, and wildebeest
Includes lions, leopards, hyenas, and wild dogs

notableSpecies.name: African Elephant
notableSpecies.significance: Keystone species, crucial for ecosystem health

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: Mangrove forests, salt marshes, and mudflats along the Atlantic and Indian Ocean coasts, providing vital habitat for marine life.

statistics.details: Diverse mangrove species adapted to varying salinity levels
Important nesting and feeding grounds for migratory birds
